com.spartanlaboratories.util

Class Tracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.spartanlaboratories.util.Tracker

  • public class Tracker
extends java.lang.Object

      Constructor and Description
      Tracker() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEntity(java.lang.String newEntity)
      Adds a new item to this class's list of tracked entities
      void displayStats()
      Displays how long each added entity took to run.
      void giveEndTime(java.lang.String entity)
      Gives the Tracker information about when the passed in entity ended executing.
      void giveStartTime(java.lang.String entity)
      Gives the Tracker information about when the passed in entity started executing.
      void runInBackGround()
      Makes the tracker run on a separate thread allowing it to display stats by itself at a time period set by setNotifyPeriod(int) (default is 15 seconds).
      void setNotifyPeriod(int notifyPeriod)
      Changes the notification period for the printing out the stats of the given entities.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tracker

        public Tracker()

    • Method Detail

      • addEntity

        public void addEntity(java.lang.String newEntity)
        Adds a new item to this class's list of tracked entities
        Parameters:
        newEntity - - the name of the new entity

      • giveStartTime

        public void giveStartTime(java.lang.String entity)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          com.spartanlaboratories.util.OutOfOrderException
        Gives the Tracker information about when the passed in entity started executing. It is ought to be called before starting the execution of whatever code that is being tracked by this entity. Has to be called before calling giveEndTime(String). Cannot be called twice without calling giveEndTime(String) between the two calls.
        Parameters:
        entity - - the entity that has started executing.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - throws if the entity argument does not yet exist (if it has not added with the addEntity(String)
        com.spartanlaboratories.util.OutOfOrderException - - throws if this method was called previously for this entity and was not followed up by calling giveEndTime(String) which has to be called once before this method can be called again.

      • giveEndTime

        public void giveEndTime(java.lang.String entity)
                 throws com.spartanlaboratories.util.OutOfOrderException,
                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gives the Tracker information about when the passed in entity ended executing. It is ought to be called after ending the execution of whatever code that is being tracked by this entity. Has to be called once after calling giveStartTime(String). Cannot be called twice without another giveStartTime(String) call in between.
        Parameters:
        entity - - the entity that has ended executing
        Throws:
        com.spartanlaboratories.util.OutOfOrderException - - throws if this method was called without a call of the method giveStartTime(String) which has to precede the call of this method.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - throws if the entity argument does not yet exist (if it has not added with the addEntity(String)

      • runInBackGround

        public void runInBackGround()
        Makes the tracker run on a separate thread allowing it to display stats by itself at a time period set by setNotifyPeriod(int) (default is 15 seconds).

      • setNotifyPeriod

        public void setNotifyPeriod(int notifyPeriod)
        Changes the notification period for the printing out the stats of the given entities. This only matters if the runInBackGround() method was called.
        Parameters:
        notifyPeriod - - the notification period in seconds

      • displayStats

        public void displayStats()
        Displays how long each added entity took to run. Also displays comparative stats to show how well the entities are running in comparison to each other.
